pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:0.4.eng: The subchapter on containing living beings

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:0.5.eng: 64. The training rule on what is grave

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto sañcetanikaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitvā bhātuno saddhivihārikassa bhikkhuno ārocesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.2.eng: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had committed an offense of intentional emission of semen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.3.eng: He told his brother’s student about this,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu sañcetanikaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitvā saṅghaṃ tassā āpattiyā parivāsaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.5.eng: Soon afterwards another monk also committed an offense of intentional emission of semen. He asked the Sangha for probation,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.6.pli: Tassa saṅgho tassā āpattiyā parivāsaṃ adāsi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.7.pli: So parivasanto taṃ bhikkhuṃ passitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.7.eng: While he was on probation, he saw Upananda’s brother’s student and said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.8.pli: “ahaṃ, āvuso, sañcetanikaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitvā saṅghaṃ tassā āpattiyā parivāsaṃ yāciṃ, tassa me saṅgho tassā āpattiyā parivāsaṃ adāsi, sohaṃ parivasāmi, vediyāmahaṃ, āvuso, vediyatīti maṃ āyasmā dhāretū”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.8.eng: “I’ve committed an offense of intentional emission of semen. I asked the Sangha for probation, which I got. I’m now undergoing probation. Please remember me as such.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.9.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, yo aññopi imaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati sopi evaṃ karotī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.9.eng: “Do others who have committed this offense need to do the same?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.11.pli: “Ayaṃ, āvuso, āyasmā upanando sakyaputto sañcetanikaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitvā so me āroceti mā kassaci ārocehī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.11.eng: “Venerable Upananda committed this offense and told me not to tell anyone.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.14.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.14.eng: That monk then told other monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.15.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.15.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.16.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu bhikkhussa jānaṃ duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ paṭicchādessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.16.eng: “How could a monk knowingly conceal a monk’s grave offense?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.17.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhikkhussa jānaṃ duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ paṭicchādesī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.17.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.20.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, bhikkhussa jānaṃ duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ paṭicchādessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.20.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.22.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.22.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.23.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa jānaṃ duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ paṭicchādeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.23.1.eng: ‘If a monk knowingly conceals a monk’s grave offense, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.8.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti aññe vā tassa ārocenti, so vā āroceti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.8.eng: he knows by himself or others have told him or the offender has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.8.comm: The meaning of the last of these three ways of knowing, so vā āroceti, is not clear. CPD suggests: “sa (sā) āroceti (?). Perhaps this last form is conformable to sa. ārocayate med. caus. in the meaning: he or she makes inquiries (of others).” However, this does not fit with the parallel usage at Bu Pc 29:3.1.6 where the text says that she tells (sā vā āroceti) him, presumably referring to the nun telling the monk. In this case āroceti cannot refer to the monk making inquiries. The commentaries are silent, and I therefore assume that a straightforward meaning is the most likely one. I would suggest, then, that it simply refers to the other monk telling him directly.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.10.pli: cattāri ca pārājikāni terasa ca saṅghādisesā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.10.eng: the four offenses entailing expulsion and the thirteen entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.12.pli: “imaṃ jānitvā codessanti, sāressanti khuṃsessanti, vambhessanti, maṅkuṃ karissanti nārocessāmī”ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.12.eng: thinking, “If they find out about this, they’ll accuse him, remind him, scold him, censure him, humiliate him; I won’t tell,” then by the mere fact of abandoning his duty, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.1.pli: Duṭṭhullāya āpattiyā duṭṭhullāpattisaññī paṭicchādeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.1.eng: If it is a grave offense, and he perceives it as such, and he conceals it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.2.pli: Duṭṭhullāya āpattiyā vematiko paṭicchādeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.2.eng: If it is a grave offense, but he is unsure of it, and he conceals it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.3.pli: Duṭṭhullāya āpattiyā aduṭṭhullāpattisaññī paṭicchādeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.3.eng: If it is a grave offense, but he perceives it as minor, and he conceals it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.4.eng: If he conceals a minor offense, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.5.pli: Anupasampannassa duṭṭhullaṃ vā aduṭṭhullaṃ vā ajjhācāraṃ paṭicchādeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.5.eng: If he conceals the grave or minor misconduct of one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.6.eng: If it is a minor offense, but he perceives it as grave, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.7.eng: If it is a minor offense, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.8.eng: If it is a minor offense, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.2.pli: “saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ vā kalaho vā viggaho vā vivādo vā bhavissatī”ti nāroceti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.2.eng: if he does not tell because he thinks there will be quarrels or disputes in the Sangha;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.3.eng: if he does not tell because he thinks there will be a fracture or schism in the Sangha;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.4.pli: “ayaṃ kakkhaḷo pharuso jīvitantarāyaṃ vā brahmacariyantarāyaṃ vā karissatī”ti nāroceti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.4.eng: if he does not tell because he thinks the person he is telling about is cruel and harsh and that he might become a threat to life or to the monastic life;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.5.eng: if he does not tell because he does not see any suitable monks;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.6.eng: if he does not tell, but not because he wants to conceal;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.7.eng: if he does not tell because he thinks the other person will be known through his own actions;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.9.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.10.eng: The training rule on what is grave, the fourth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:0.4.eng: The subchapter on containing living beings

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:0.5.eng: 65. The training rule on less than twenty years old

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe sattarasavaggiyā dārakā sahāyakā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.2.eng: At that time in Rājagaha there was a group of seventeen boys who were friends,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.5.pli: “kena nu kho upāyena upāli amhākaṃ accayena sukhañca jīveyya na ca kilameyyā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.5.eng: “How can we make sure that Upāli is able to live happily without exhausting himself after we’ve passed away?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.7.pli: “sace kho upāli lekhaṃ sikkheyya, evaṃ kho upāli amhākaṃ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.9.pli: “sace kho upāli lekhaṃ sikkhissati, aṅguliyo dukkhā bhavissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.9.eng: but then his fingers will hurt.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.10.pli: Sace kho upāli gaṇanaṃ sikkheyya, evaṃ kho upāli amhākaṃ accayena sukhañca jīveyya na ca kilameyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.10.eng: Or he could become an accountant,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.12.pli: “sace kho upāli gaṇanaṃ sikkhissati, urassa dukkho bhavissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.12.eng: but then his chest will hurt.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.13.pli: Sace kho upāli rūpaṃ sikkheyya, evaṃ kho upāli amhākaṃ accayena sukhañca jīveyya na ca kilameyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.13.eng: Or he could become a banker,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.15.pli: “sace kho upāli rūpaṃ sikkhissati, akkhīni dukkhā bhavissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.15.eng: but then his eyes will hurt.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.16.pli: Ime kho samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sukhasīlā sukhasamācārā subhojanāni bhuñjitvā nivātesu sayanesu sayanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.16.eng: But these Sakyan monastics have pleasant habits and a happy life. They eat nice food and sleep in beds sheltered from the wind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.17.pli: Sace kho upāli samaṇesu sakyaputtiyesu pabbajeyya, evaṃ kho upāli amhākaṃ accayena sukhañca jīveyya, na ca kilameyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.17.eng: If Upāli goes forth with them, he’ll be able to live happily without exhausting himself after we’ve passed away.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.18.pli: Assosi kho upālidārako mātāpitūnaṃ imaṃ kathāsallāpaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.18.eng: Upāli overheard this conversation between his parents.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.19.pli: Atha kho upālidārako yena te dārakā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te dārake etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.19.eng: He then went to the other boys and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.20.eng: “Come, let’s go forth with the Sakyan monastics.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.21.pli: “Sace kho tvaṃ, ayya, pabbajissasi, evaṃ mayampi pabbajissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.21.eng: “If you go forth, so will we.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.22.pli: Atha kho te dārakā ekamekassa mātāpitaro upasaṅkamitvā etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.22.eng: The boys went each to his own parents and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.23.eng: “Please allow me to go forth into homelessness.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.25.eng: Since the parents knew that the boys all had the same desire and good intention, they gave their approval.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.26.eng: The boys then went to the monks and asked for the going forth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.27.eng: And the monks gave them the going forth and the full ordination.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.28.eng: Soon afterwards they got up early in the morning and cried,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.29.eng: “Give us congee, give us a meal, give us fresh food.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.32.eng: If any of that becomes available then, you can have it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.35.pli: No ce bhavissati yāgu vā bhattaṃ vā khādanīyaṃ vā, piṇḍāya caritvā bhuñjissathā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.35.eng: If not, you’ll eat after walking for alms.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.36.pli: Evampi kho te bhikkhū bhikkhūhi vuccamānā rodantiyeva—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.36.eng: But they carried on as before.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.38.eng: And they defecated and urinated on the furniture.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.39.pli: Assosi kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya dārakasaddaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.39.eng: After rising early in the morning, the Buddha heard the sound of those boys.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.42.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.42.eng: who told him what was happening.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.43.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.43.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.44.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū jānaṃ ūnavīsativassaṃ puggalaṃ upasampādentī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.44.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks give the full ordination to people they know are less than twenty years old?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.47.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā jānaṃ ūnavīsativassaṃ puggalaṃ upasampādessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.47.eng: “How can those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.48.pli: Ūnakavīsativasso, bhikkhave, puggalo akkhamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṃsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṃ duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ anadhivāsakajātiko hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.48.eng: A person who is less than twenty years old is unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, and the burning sun; creeping animals and insects; and rude and unwelcome speech. And they are unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.48.comm: Sp-ṭ 4.295: Sarīsapeti ye keci sarante gacchante dīghajātike, “Sarīsape: whatever long creatures are moving by flowing.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.49.pli: Vīsativassova kho, bhikkhave, puggalo khamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.49.eng: But a person who’s twenty is able to endure these things.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.52.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.52.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.53.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ ūnavīsativassaṃ puggalaṃ upasampādeyya, so ca puggalo anupasampanno, te ca bhikkhū gārayhā, idaṃ tasmiṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.53.1.eng: ‘If a monk gives the full ordination to a person he knows is less than twenty years old, he commits an offense entailing confession. Moreover, that person has not received the full ordination and those monks are blameworthy.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.6.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti, aññe vā tassa ārocenti, so vā āroceti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.6.eng: he knows by himself or others have told him or the candidate has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.6.comm: The meaning of the last of these three ways of knowing, so vā āroceti, is not clear. CPD suggests: “sa (sā) āroceti (?). Perhaps this last form is conformable to sa. ārocayate med. caus. in the meaning: he or she makes inquiries (of others).” However, this does not fit with the parallel usage at Bu Pc 29:3.1.6 where the text says that she tells (sā vā āroceti) him, presumably referring to the nun telling the monk. In this case āroceti cannot refer to the monk making inquiries. The commentaries are silent, and I therefore assume that a straightforward meaning is the most likely one. I would suggest, then, that it simply refers to the person wrongly ordained telling the monk directly.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.8.eng: who has not reached twenty years.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.9.pli: “Upasampādessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariyaṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.9.eng: If, intending to give the full ordination, he searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or he establishes a monastery zone, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.9.comm: “Monastery zone” renders sīmā. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.10.eng: After the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.10.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.11.eng: After each of the first two announcements, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.12.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.13.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariyassa ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.13.eng: while the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.1.eng: If the other person is less than twenty years old, and he perceives them as less, and he gives them the full ordination, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.2.eng: If the other person is less than twenty years old, but he is unsure of it, and he gives them the full ordination, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.3.eng: If the other person is less than twenty years old, but he perceives them as more, and he gives them the full ordination, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.4.eng: If the other person is more than twenty years old, but he perceives them as less, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.5.eng: If the other person is more than twenty years old, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.6.eng: If the other person is more than twenty years old, and he perceives them as more, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.3.2.eng: if he gives the full ordination to someone less than twenty years old, but he perceives them as more than twenty;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.3.3.eng: if he gives the full ordination to someone more than twenty years old, and he perceives them as more than twenty;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.3.5.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.3.6.eng: The training rule on less than twenty years old, the fifth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:0.4.eng: The subchapter on containing living beings

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:0.5.eng: 66. The training rule on a group of traveling thieves

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro sattho rājagahā paṭiyālokaṃ gantukāmo hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.2.eng: a certain group of travelers was about to go south from Rājagaha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.3.eng: A monk said to those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.6.comm: Pajānāth’āvuso, literally, “You know, friends.” According to the commentary to DN-a 2.436: Tvaṁ pajānāhīti tvaṁ jāna. Sace gaṇhitukāmosi, gaṇhāhīti vuttaṁ hoti, “Tvaṁ pajānāhi: you know. If you wish to take it, please do: this is what is meant.” In other words, it’s up to you to do what you like.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.10.pli: Atha kho te kammiyā taṃ satthaṃ gahetvā acchinditvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.10.eng: caught the group, confiscated the goods, and asked that monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.11.pli: “kissa tvaṃ, bhante, jānaṃ theyyasatthena saddhiṃ gacchasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.11.eng: “Venerable, why are you knowingly traveling with a group of thieves?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.13.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.13.eng: After being released, that monk went to Sāvatthī, where he told the monks what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.14.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.14.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.15.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu jānaṃ theyyasatthena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.15.eng: “How could a monk knowingly travel by arrangement with a group of thieves?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.16.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, jānaṃ theyyasatthena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.16.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.19.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, jānaṃ theyyasatthena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.19.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.21.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.21.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.22.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ theyyasatthena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya, antamaso gāmantarampi, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:1.22.1.eng: ‘If a monk knowingly travels by arrangement with a group of thieves, even just to the next inhabited area, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.6.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti, aññe vā tassa ārocenti, so vā āroceti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.6.eng: he knows by himself or others have told him or the group of travelers has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.6.comm: The meaning of the last of these three ways of knowing, so vā āroceti, is not clear. CPD suggests: “sa (sā) āroceti (?). Perhaps this last form is conformable to sa. ārocayate med. caus. in the meaning: he or she makes inquiries (of others).” However, this does not fit with the parallel usage at Bu Pc 29:3.1.6 where the text says that she tells (sā vā āroceti) him, presumably referring to the nun telling the monk. In this case āroceti cannot refer to the monk making inquiries. The commentaries are silent, and I therefore assume that a straightforward meaning is the most likely one. I would suggest, then, that it refers to the group of travelers (i.e. the thieves or one of them) telling the monk directly.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.8.pli: corā katakammā vā honti akatakammā vā, rājānaṃ vā theyyaṃ gacchanti suṅkaṃ vā pariharanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.8.eng: thieves who have done their deed or thieves who have not. They are stealing from the king or smuggling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.12.pli: “gacchāmāvuso, gacchāma, bhante; gacchāma, bhante, gacchāmāvuso, ajja vā hiyyo vā pare vā gacchāmā”ti saṃvidahati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.12.eng: if he makes an arrangement like this: the monk says, “Let’s go,” and they reply, “Yes, let’s go, venerable;” or they say, “Let’s go, venerable,” and the monk replies, “Yes, let’s go;” or the monk says, “Let’s go today,” “Let’s go tomorrow,” or “Let’s go the day after tomorrow,” then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.13.eng: Even just to the next inhabited area:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.14.pli: kukkuṭasampāte gāme gāmantare gāmantare āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.14.eng: when the inhabited areas are a chicken’s flight apart, then for every next inhabited area he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.15.pli: Agāmake araññe addhayojane addhayojane āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.15.eng: When it is an uninhabited area, a wilderness, then for every six kilometers he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.1.15.comm: For a discussion of the yojana, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.1.pli: Theyyasatthe theyyasatthasaññī saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjati, antamaso gāmantarampi, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.1.eng: If it is a group of traveling thieves, and he perceives it as such, and he travels by arrangement with them, even just to the next inhabited area, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.2.pli: Theyyasatthe vematiko saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjati, antamaso gāmantarampi, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.2.eng: If it is a group of traveling thieves, but he is unsure of it, and he travels by arrangement with them, even just to the next inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.3.pli: Theyyasatthe atheyyasatthasaññī saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjati, antamaso gāmantarampi, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.3.eng: If it is a group of traveling thieves, but he does not perceive it as such, and he travels by arrangement with them, even just to the next inhabited area, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.4.pli: Bhikkhu saṃvidahati, manussā na saṃvidahanti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.4.eng: If the monk makes an arrangement, but the group does not express its agreement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.5.eng: If it is not a group of traveling thieves, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.6.eng: If it is not a group of traveling thieves, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.2.7.eng: If it is not a group of traveling thieves, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.3.2.eng: if he goes, but not by arrangement;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.3.3.eng: if the group has made an arrangement, but he has not expressed his agreement;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.3.4.eng: if he goes, but not according to the arrangement;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.3.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc66:2.3.8.eng: The training rule on a group of traveling thieves, the sixth, is finished.
